pageContext.claim: “By expanding our Senate majority, the voters have also clearly rebuked the Senate Democrats for their handling of the Kavanaugh hearings. That was a factor. I think maybe a very big factor. The way that was handled, I think, was -- tremendous energy was given to the Republican Party by the way they treated then-Judge Kavanaugh, now Justice Kavanaugh.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's election analysis is flawed. Sen. Jon Tester (D-Mont.) voted against Brett Kavanaugh's nomination to the Supreme Court and won reelection. In Tennessee, Democratic candidate Phil Bredesen said he would have voted for Kavanaugh and lost nonetheless. In Nevada, Sen. Dean Heller (R) lost his seat to a Democrat despite having voted for Kavanaugh.
